text: Nellie Flag (1932–1953) was an American Thoroughbred racehorse who was retrospectively named the American Champion Two-Year-Old Filly of 1934.Thoroughbred Heritage She was the first horse bred by Warren Wright's Calumet Farm to win a stakes race.Chicago Daily Tribune – December 29, 1950 An early favorite, Nellie Flag finished fourth in the 1935 Kentucky Derby Milwaukee Journal - May 7, 1935 and seventh in the Preakness Stakes, the latter a race won by her dam in 1924.St. Petersburg Times – May 17, 1980 Following an injury, Nellie Flag was retired in mid July 1935 St. Petersburg Times - 17 July 17, 1935 and stood at Calumet Farm as a broodmare where she died in 1953 at age twenty-one. She produced ten foals of which nine raced.Nellie Flag's offspring Among her best were: * Mar-Kell (born 1939) - American Champion Older Female Horse (1943) * Nellie L. (born 1940) - won 1943 Kentucky Oaks, Acorn Stakes * Sunshine Nell (born 1948) - multiple stakes wins including Barbara Fritchie Handicap, Autumn Days Handicap, Top Flight Handicap ==References== * Nellie Flag's pedigree and partial racing stats Category:1932 racehorse births Category:1953 racehorse deaths Category:Racehorses bred in Kentucky Category:Racehorses trained in the United States Category:American Champion racehorses Category:Thoroughbred family 9-f
